cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles east of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to parallel the Southeast U.S. coast, turn north Wednesday night, then curve north-northeast and pass south-southeast of New England on Saturday before accelerating toward Nova Scotia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: along or very near the South Carolina/North Carolina coast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect from the NC/VA border to Chincoteague VA and Chesapeake Bay south of Smith Point
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning from Sebastian Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL and from Savannah River to Surf City NC; Storm Surge Warning Jupiter Inlet FL to Surf City NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. Atlantic coastline from Florida through New England, including Massachusetts shoreline
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤9%) of sustained 34-kt (39-mph) winds; occasional gusts to 40 mph possible Saturday as the center passes southeast of Cape Cod.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Boston; surge threat confined south of Cape Lookout NC in current advisory.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rain possible in eastern Massachusetts Saturday into early Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swells and dangerous rip currents will reach the Massachusetts coast late week, posing a hazard to harbor approaches and pilot boarding operations.
